Class Person

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • ClubAbstractEntity
                • Person
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Soldier, Student

    public class Person
extends ClubAbstractEntity
    The Person class - this class represents the ordinary person's fields. It extends ClubAbstractEntity and therefore it inherits its JFrame abilities, and becomes a frame of its own, which hold all the neccessery information and methods of a person clubber.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected javax.swing.JLabel[] strikes
      strike - an array for storing the strikes labels ("*") indexed the same as the values as well
      protected javax.swing.JTextField[] textFields
      textFields - this field is used for the fields which are indexed in the same order of the values.
      protected java.lang.String[] values
      Values - an array that holds all the values of the person: values[0] - id, valued[1] - name, values[2] - surName, values[3] - phone number.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Person()
      empty constructor that call the actual 4 parameters constructor with empty Strings so that all the gui components will be made.
      Person(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String surname, java.lang.String tel)
      The constructors job is to initialize every gui component of the persons data and sends them to the center of the parents window via ClubAbstractEntity.addToCenter(java.awt.Component) It also uses the ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericStrikeLabel(), ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericTextField(java.lang.String) and ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericRow(java.lang.String, javax.swing.JTextField, javax.swing.JLabel) method to make the constructor more organized and keep the consistency of the design.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void commit()
      this function writes the information into our database after the validation was successful.
      boolean match(java.lang.String key)
      A function that tells us if a given string is equal to the id of the person which tells us if he is in our database
      protected void rollBack()
      this function controls what happens when we hit cancel it writes the previous valid values into the textfields
      protected boolean validateData()
      a function to control the validation if the database values, it helps us to maintain a consistent database where every value inside it is valid(using String.matches(java.lang.String) and Pattern-regular expression patterns).

    • Field Detail

      • values

        protected java.lang.String[] values
        Values - an array that holds all the values of the person: values[0] - id, valued[1] - name, values[2] - surName, values[3] - phone number.

      • textFields

        protected javax.swing.JTextField[] textFields
        textFields - this field is used for the fields which are indexed in the same order of the values.

      • strikes

        protected javax.swing.JLabel[] strikes
        strike - an array for storing the strikes labels ("*") indexed the same as the values as well

    • Constructor Detail

      • Person

        public Person()
        empty constructor that call the actual 4 parameters constructor with empty Strings so that all the gui components will be made. used for making a new empty entity for the system.

      • Person

        public Person(java.lang.String id,
              java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String surname,
              java.lang.String tel)
        The constructors job is to initialize every gui component of the persons data and sends them to the center of the parents window via ClubAbstractEntity.addToCenter(java.awt.Component) It also uses the ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericStrikeLabel(), ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericTextField(java.lang.String) and ClubAbstractEntity.createGenericRow(java.lang.String, javax.swing.JTextField, javax.swing.JLabel) method to make the constructor more organized and keep the consistency of the design. (also prevents duplicating code).
        Parameters:
        id - the actual id value of the person
        name - the actual name value of the person
        surname - the actual surname value of the person
        tel - the actual telephone value of the person

    • Method Detail

      • match

        public boolean match(java.lang.String key)
        A function that tells us if a given string is equal to the id of the person which tells us if he is in our database
        Specified by:
        match in class ClubAbstractEntity
        Parameters:
        key - a key to match to
        Returns:
        true if the key that was given is equal to the id.

      • validateData

        protected boolean validateData()
        a function to control the validation if the database values, it helps us to maintain a consistent database where every value inside it is valid(using String.matches(java.lang.String) and Pattern-regular expression patterns). if a values is not valid- a red mark will be shown next to it. In addition this function will check if this persons id is already in the database, if it is it will return false.
        Specified by:
        validateData in class ClubAbstractEntity
        Returns:
        true if the validation went successfully, returns false otherwise

      • commit

        protected void commit()
        this function writes the information into our database after the validation was successful.
        Specified by:
        commit in class ClubAbstractEntity

      • rollBack

        protected void rollBack()
        this function controls what happens when we hit cancel it writes the previous valid values into the textfields
        Specified by:
        rollBack in class ClubAbstractEntity
